rss.channel:
广告牌 https://www.billboard.com音乐图表，新闻，照片和视频星期三，2025年2月19日22:00:57 +0000 En-us小时1 https://wordpress.org/?v=6.5.5 200641670 “成为LED Zeppelin”导演分享了Rock Doc的Uphill Battle的故事https://www.billboard.com/music/rock/becoming-led-led-zeppelin-film-documentary-interview-1235905673/Joe Lynch Wed, 19 Feb 2025 22:00:51 +0000 MusicRockfilm and tv https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235905673 With new interviews, rare archival footage and a skull-rattling soundtrack, there's a whole lot to love about this theatrical experience.

不到两周前开业，成为齐柏林飞艇的LED已经接近600万美元的国际票房总额。在大多数纪录片直接直接流媒体的时代，Rock Doc的票房运行 - 不提到它在IMAX屏幕上播放的事实 - 是一场小型政变。主吉他手吉米·佩奇（Jimmy Page）在社交媒体上写道：“我必须说，粉丝的反馈只是谦卑而鼓舞人心。”

这也是联合导演伯纳德·麦克马洪（Bernard MacMahon）和艾莉森·麦格尔蒂（Allison McGourty）的骄傲之源，他们被告知这部电影不会受到一个持怀疑态度的工作室的四美元。根据Macmahon和McGourty的说法，除了Song Pictures经典之外，所有主要的工作室都通过了Led Zeppelin 。鉴于传奇乐队的跨代流行度以及导演对乐队难以捉摸的幸存成员进行了广泛的采访，这有点令人惊讶。但这也很合适 - 这不是齐柏林飞艇第一次面临冷漠（或完全敌对的）批评家，并证明他们是错误的。

Zep的职业生涯跨越了9张专辑和12年，在鼓手John Bonham在1980年去世时有效地结束了，这部电影的重点是乐队的早期，使用访谈，稀有的档案片段和无与伦比的配乐（只需试图抵制剧院中的头脑）讲述了四个来自不同背景的英国男孩如何创造出蓝色，硬摇滚，R＆B和民间的炼金术混合物，这些混合物改变了摇滚乐队演奏，录制和巡回演出。

Billboard与联合导演Macmahon和McGourty坐下来，了解了他们如何锁定对Page，Robert Plant和John Paul Jones的采访，这部电影为何在Led Zeppelin II之后停止，以及一些乐队的当代人对电影的放映有何反应。

你们俩都在美国史诗公司（American Epic）上合作，这是一部令人印象深刻且全面的纪录片，讲述了美国蓝调，乡村和民间音乐的首次录音。这是否有助于您为这部纪录片招募LED齐柏林飞艇的尚存成员吗？该系列非常是他们的音乐。

伯纳德·麦克马洪（Bernard MacMahon）：这是这部电影存在的基本原因。

艾莉森·麦格蒂（ Allison McGourty）：没有美国史诗（American Epic）就不会成为齐柏林飞艇（Led Zeppelin） 。

麦克马洪（Macmahon ）：艾莉森（Allison）有这个想法是做美国史诗（American Epic） ，并讲述了第一批布鲁斯，福音，乡村和卡琼（Cajun）记录在美国以及1920年代和30年代制作的唱片。因此，她得到了她的电影制片人的朋友，曾拍了披头士乐队选集电影的杰夫·沃尔福（Geoff Wonfor）与我见面说服我，这对电影来说是个好主意。我们在艾莉森（Allison）的领导下做到了这一点，然后我来找她说：“你知道什么是一部很棒的后续电影吗？当我12岁的时候，我读了这本关于LED齐柏林飞艇的小平装书。它已经绝版了，它是在70年代出版的，它是早期的故事，其中包含所有这些信息已经丢失。它不是LED Zeppelin Lexicon的一部分，它被80年代的所有这些小报所取代，由一个与他们一起巡回演出的家伙撰写了一个星期。”这本书是由一个人霍华德·迈利特（Howard Mylett）撰写的，他确实可以接近他们。我12岁时读了它，我发现它鼓舞人心，这四个来自英国不同地区的孩子试图在音乐中脱颖而出。

麦格蒂：那是不寻常的。两个来自伦敦，两个来自西米德兰兹。通常情况下，这永远不会发生：滚石乐队全都来自伦敦，甲壳虫乐队全都来自利物浦。来自西米德兰兹的人们很难闯入音乐界，所以他们根本有点奇迹。他们自己的背景故事完全不同。吉米·佩奇（Jimmy Page）得到了他妈妈的支持。约翰·保罗·琼斯（John Paul Jones）来自一个娱乐圈家庭，他的爸爸妈妈是杂耍表演。约翰·邦纳姆（John Bonham），他的父母只要照顾家人，他的父母就不介意他做了什么。罗伯特·普兰特（Robert Plant）被扔掉了，因为他不会成为会计师。他变得无家可归。

他谈论无家可归的电影的一部分是非常激动的。当然，当他们聚在一起时，这仍然是一场艰苦的战斗。

麦克马洪：彼得·格兰特（Peter Grant）无法在英国获得唱片交易，没有人得到[他们的音乐]。人们不会预订乐队。他们必须去美国并按照自己的条件进行。香草·福吉（Vanilla Fudge）是唯一将他们带到他们的翅膀下并支持他们的团体。

您是如何设法降落页面，植物和琼斯来坐下来的有关LED齐柏林飞机的相机采访的？那是罕见的。

麦克马洪：我们已经做了数月的准备工作，包括追踪约翰·邦纳姆的每一次采访。几个知道我们在做什么的人说我们绝对生气（因为乐队都对每部电影都拒绝。但是我们相信并继续做这项工作。这是给读者的信息：努力工作并遵循自己的梦想。我没有什么特别的 - 我不是弗朗西斯·福特·科波拉（Francis Ford Coppola）的儿子，我不是坐在一堆奥斯卡金像奖上，但是我们确实做了这部电影《美国史诗》（American Epic ），我们努力工作了10年，我们做了不进行捷径。这意味着当我们到达（乐队）而他们碰巧见过（美国史诗）时，他们知道那部电影中没有捷径 - 没有石头没有扭曲 - 他们想：“好吧，他们会应用那个给我们。”我们做到了。这是与约翰·保罗·琼斯（John Paul Jones）的五小时会议，与罗伯特·普特（Robert Plant）和帕特·邦纳（Pat Bonham）类似，以及与吉米·佩奇（Jimmy Page）的七个小时会议。

我敢打赌很多粉丝不知道的电影中的齐柏林飞艇时代有很多东西。

麦克马洪：我记得我对（页面）说：“这是您第一次看到罗伯特唱歌的时候。”他说：“该小组的名字是什么？” “ obs-tweedle。”

他在测试你吗？

麦克马洪：是的！当我们走到最后时，他说：“这是一部很棒的电影，我们很荣幸能让您成功。”他给了我们艺术自由。他们让我们拍电影，没有编辑电影。那永远不会发生。 （大多数）成功的小组，他们控制着一切。

McGourty ：他们确实带来了以前从未发行过的其他照片和录音。

麦克马洪：我们从未见过的东西。在打算从不这样做之后，当他们确实同意这样做时，我们很荣幸 - 他们在舞台上Led Zeppelin所做的途中变得全力以赴。他们带有一袋东西。他们打算坦诚和诚实。观看它们是如此激动，因为其他材料使它更加情感。当约翰·保罗·琼斯（John Paul Jones）谈论这位牧师时说：“您可以成为14岁的他可以成为风琴家和合唱大师”时，我一直在向他展示那个教堂的照片。他在那里两年后，那个教堂被推销。它完全迷失了。因此，他正在看这个，想起这个很棒的人，所以情绪是新鲜的。

您谈论Led Zeppelin如何拥有电影中第一张专辑的唱片。他们对出版也很精明。您在没有制作电影的采访中学到的关于乐队的业务策略或Grant的业务实践有什么吗？

麦克马洪（Macmahon ）：我想拍一部电影，那就是我13岁时会在当地的电影院看，想看三到四次。我们在电影中放映的是，如果您是一个孩子，我们认为这很有用。有一点，您停下来进行细节，然后说：“也许是晚上。”我们想通过情感上的大笔刺穿会引起孩子共鸣的大笔触，这些人从来没有坐在他们的手上。无论他们是像在中部地区的罗伯特·普特（Robert Plant）和约翰·邦纳（John Bonham）一样挣扎，还是像吉米（Jimmy）和琼斯（Jonesy）这样的音乐界的一部分，他们都在研究每件事。吉米（Jimmy）来参加会议，他倾向于看看工程师在做什么，并扮演自己的角色。罗伯特正在尝试一切。在LED齐柏林飞艇之前，他与英国蓝调界的父亲亚历克西斯·科纳（Alexis Korner）唱歌。他们把自己放在那里，尝试一切。这就是信息。所有的事情（人们）都被告知他们现在需要做：Tiktok，Instagram，您不需要所有这些东西。您只需要两个或三个，理想情况下，尽可能宽的口味即可使其尽可能丰富多彩，然后遵循您的肠道告诉您的事情。但是你必须在那里，你必须工作，你必须学习。让您与观众的回应 - 即使是10个人，然后是15个人 - 告知您在做什么。但是不要让这些人告诉你该怎么做。这就是我们作为电影制片人进入粗略切割时发现的信息。我们把它带到了每个工作室，除了Sony Pictures Classics外，每个主要的工作室都像是：“没有人会看这部电影。没有人会在电影院观看完整的LED齐柏林飞艇歌曲。”

麦格蒂：有人告诉我们，这部电影不会得到四美元。无论如何我们继续进行。它与（电影中的故事）平行。

麦克马洪（MacMahon ）：齐柏林飞艇（Led Zeppelin）的故事对我们来说是一个教训。

这部电影没有涉足任何关于乐队的更卑鄙的谣言。这是制片厂的反馈的一部分吗？他们想在电影中更多的丑闻吗？

麦克马洪：有些是的。他们认为人们只会坐下来观看有关放荡的电影。

McGourty ：齐柏林飞艇（Led Zeppelin）由于音乐而成为世界上最大的乐队。这就是人们喜欢的和粉丝想要听到的。

麦克马洪（MacMahon ）：这部电影允许您以最纯粹的方式听到音乐。这部（电影具有）鲍勃·路德维希（Bob Ludwig）在69年完成的原始漆切割。这是一段声音的旅程 - 它本来应该拥有的确切声音。这部电影的音频没有压缩。这是巨大的高峰和槽。这是动态，这就是LED齐柏林飞艇所用的东西。这就是为什么观众回应它的原因 - 他们得到了纯净，高质量的东西而没有压缩，没有屠杀。

是否有任何档案库可切的痛苦？

麦克马洪：没什么。

麦格蒂：彼得·格兰特（Peter Grant），如果他抓住某人在演出中拍摄的人，他会撕下电影，砸碎相机，物理弹出。他们没有在做媒体。我们已经知道所有碎片存在。

麦克马洪：我刚刚发现（最近）发现了一些剪辑，但幸运的是，这是一首我们已经在全彩的令人难以置信的表演，而（新的）是黑白的。甲壳虫乐队一直在宣传大量宣传，因此有无休止的照片会议和电视采访。齐柏林飞艇是完全相反的。太少了。

McGourty ：从某种意义上说，它使电影更加艰难，因为您几乎没有与之合作的镜头，但它迫使我们发挥创造力。我们受到黄金时代的电影的启发，在弗兰克·卡普拉（Frank Capra）的《雷宁》中。我们使用了诸如蒙太奇工作的旧电影中的许多技术。您会看到报纸，合同，门票 - 我们有6,000多个文物数字化。 （您在电影中看到的一切）都是真实的。

麦克马洪：我们为鲍勃·威尔（Bob Weir）和泰姬陵（Taj Mahal）进行了筛选，他们是湾区反文化的国王。当齐柏林飞艇破裂时，他们在那里。威尔在电影的结尾向我交给了我，说：“你知道，这是改变游戏规则的东西。每个孩子都应该看着这是他们的祖父母所做的以及他们如何做到这一点。你知道我看着这些家伙在想什么吗？他们和歌手一起让我想起了约翰·科尔特兰（John Coltrane）的三人组。或带有歌手的法罗亚·桑德斯（Pharoah Sanders）。”从鲍勃·威尔（Bob Weir）那里，可以告诉您他看到的音乐水平。泰姬陵看到了它说 -

麦格蒂：“那部电影重新安排了我的分子。”

麦克马洪（Macmahon） ：一个已经意识到这个小组55年的人已经扩大了他的意见，并改变了他对小组的先入之见。

这部电影以他们的第二张专辑（我认为是明智的）结束，因为它可以让您真正挖掘出他们的起源故事，而不是感觉到整个故事。当您启动这个项目时，这总是意图吗？

麦克马洪：是的。在齐柏林飞艇（Led Zeppelin）的故事中，就像在任何一项伟大成就的故事中一样，有些时刻，您无所事事地来到童年时代，而您降落在月球上或攀登珠穆朗玛峰。这是电影结束的地方 - 他们登上月球，它们是地球上最大的乐队，他们终于在自己的祖国得到认可。这绝对是两小时的电影电影的结论。





; 1235905673 “ Mufasa：狮子王”可以在家中播放：这是在线观看的地方https://www.billboard.com/culture/product-recommendations/mufasa-the-lion-king-how-to-watch-online-1235903858/Rudie Obias Wed, 19 Feb 2025 21:57:15 +0000 CultureProduct Recommendationshow to watchMufasaNOADSstreamingthe lion kingTV / Film https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235903858 The 狮子王前传电影已正式播放流媒体。在这里学习在哪里看它。;

所有特色的产品和服务都是由编辑独立选择的。但是，广告牌可能会收到通过其零售链接下达的订单的佣金，零售商可能会为会计目的获得某些可审计数据。

穆法萨：狮子王是2024年最大的电影之一。但是，如果您错过了剧院，那么前传电影现在可以在家中播放。

请继续阅读以播放Mufasa的最佳方法：在线狮子王。

流式视频中的“穆法萨：狮子王”

有关的

Lin-Manuel Miranda回忆起1994年的“狮子王”之前“被吹走”，在“穆法萨”之前。

02/13/2025

如何观看Mufasa：在线狮子王

穆法萨（Mufasa）：狮子王（Lion King）以24.99美元的价格流式传输，并在Prime Video ， Apple TV和其他高级视频上按需求市场上的数字购买。

但是，购买后30天可以进入租金，一旦您开始看电影，就可以使用48小时。

流式视频中的“穆法萨：狮子王”

由巴里·詹金斯（Barry Jenkins）执导（月光，如果比尔街（Beale Street）可以说话）， 穆法萨（Mufasa）：狮子王（Lion King）是2019年狮子王（Lion King）的真人版本的前传。它跟随一只孤儿幼崽（Aaron Pierre），后者被收养到王室，成为塔卡（Kelvin Harrison Jr.）的兄弟，这是一位年轻的狮子王子，后来成为疤痕。然后，这部电影是穆法萨（Mufasa）成为骄傲之王的下一个国王的旅程。

这部电影还与塞思·罗根（Seth Rogen），比利·艾希纳（Billy Eichner），蒂芙尼·布恩（Tiffany Boone），唐纳德·格洛弗（Donald Glover），麦克克尔森（Mads Mikkelsen），桑蒂威·牛顿（Thandiwe Newton），兰妮·詹姆斯（Lennie James），阿妮卡·诺妮·玫瑰（Anika Noni Rose），蓝色常春藤卡特（Blue Ivy Carter），碧昂丝·诺尔斯·诺尔斯·卡特（BeyoncéKnowles-Carter）等。

同时， 穆法萨（Mufasa）的配乐：《狮子王》（Lion King）还展出了林·曼努埃尔·米兰达（Lin-Manuel Miranda）的原创歌曲和戴夫·梅茨格（Dave Metzger）的电影乐谱。

穆法萨（Mufasa）：狮子王（Lion King）的租金为24.99美元，或在Prime Video上以29.99美元的价格购买。同时，您可以观看下面电影的预告片，也可以在好莱坞碗上观看狮子王，其中包括詹妮弗·哈德森（Jennifer Hudson），西北部（North West）和迪斯尼+（Disney+ ）。

流式视频中的“穆法萨：狮子王”

; 1235903858 卡西·文图拉（Cassie Ventura）怀有3号婴儿https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/cassie-ventura-pregnant-baby-3-1235905611/Rania Aniftos Wed, 19 Feb 2025 21:56:46 +0000 MusicMusic News https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235905611 Ventura and her husband Alex Fine share two daughters, five-year-old Frankie and one-year-old Sunny.

祝贺Cassie Ventura和丈夫Alex Fine，他们期待他们的第三个孩子。

文图拉（Ventura）通过Instagram宣布了这一消息，分享了一系列黑白全家福，并与“ Me＆u”歌手穿着牛仔裤和白色纽扣，她的怀孕的腹部展出。在快照中，她与Fine和他们的两个女儿，五岁的Frankie和一岁的Sunny微笑。

请参阅这里的甜蜜帖子。

在歌手结束了与耻辱的嘻哈大亨肖恩·“迪迪”梳子结束了她的12年关系之后，Fine和Cassie开始约会。他们在2019年结束了结。

令人振奋的消息是在文图拉（Ventura）动荡不安的一年之后。文图拉（Ventura）是第一个指责迪迪（Diddy）性侵犯的人，他于2023年11月提起诉讼，其中卡西（Cassie）的律师声称她“忍受了十年来的暴力行为和不安的要求”，包括反复的身体攻击，并强迫她“从事性爱与男性性工作者一起行动”。根据投诉，在她试图与他分离11年后，她试图与他分开，据称Combs“迫使她进入她的家，并强奸她，而她一再说'不'离开。”此案很快就解决了，但是康姆斯随后被其他多名妇女起诉，这些妇女声称自己受到嘻哈大亨的性虐待。

Diddy于2024年9月被捕后，目前正在等待审判，该审判将于5月开始。

; 1235905611 格林苹果夫人的“淡紫色”记录第六周，在肯德里克·拉马尔（Kendrick Lamar）的“不喜欢我们”在日本Hot 100 https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/mrs-green-apple-kendrick-lamar-not-not-lamar-not-not-like-us-us-us-us-us-japan-hot-100-1235905728/Katie Atkinson Wed, 19 Feb 2025 21:56:11 +0000 Chart BeatMusicBillboard JapanGlobalJapanMusic News https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235905728 The three-man band dominates the top two slots on the Japan Hot 100 this week, with “Darling” rising 3-2.

格林苹果夫人的“淡紫色”在2月19日的Billboard Japan Hot 100中返回第一名，在图表上又增加了一周的记录。

该单曲于2024年4月12日以数字方式发行，并在7月17日的图表上首次命中第一名。本周，它上升了一个档次，以统治Tally的第六次，在悬停在前三名中三个星期后。

与前一周相比，遗忘电池开启器的流媒体和下载基本上保持不变，而卡拉OK则增加了15％。该曲目以流式传输，视频视图和卡拉OK的第一名，同时排名第四。

这支三人乐队本周在日本Hot 100上占据了前两名，“达令”上升了3-2。该赛道的视频获得了10％的收入，并从上周下载了28％。

Rosé＆Bruno Mars的“ Apt”。攀登5-3。除了卡拉OK，大多数指标的全球命中率都在放缓，卡拉OK增长了14％。该曲目排在第9位的下载，第三名，流媒体，无线电播放第26号，视频第9号，卡拉OK第24号。这位引人入胜的流行朋克单曲连续16周在Billboard Global 200上绘制，并在2月22日的图表上排名第三。

BE：First的“航天器”在上周在图表上首次亮相后排名第四。该单人在发布后的第二周出售了5,664份，并获得了第9名的销售额，视频的第二名（下降了27％），而流媒体的第18册（下降了24％）。

Kenshi Yonezu的“ Plazma”滑到第5位。移动西装Gundam gquuuuuux -Beginning-主题曲首次下载首次下载，而与上一周相比，数字下降了22％，比37％的下降幅度少于37％前一周。

Takanori Iwata的“电话号码”是流亡会员转移到Universal Music后的第一个发行版，在日本Hot 100上以51,209 CD启动，以最高销售额为最高销售，同时排名第46位。

在其他新闻中，肯德里克·拉马尔（Kendrick Lamar）的“不喜欢我们”在日本Hot 100上首次亮相，排名第86位。这是由于单曲赢得了五个格莱美奖后的广播Airplay的激增，包括年度最佳歌曲和唱片一年中 - 并在康普顿说唱歌手的超级碗中场表演表演中亮相。这首曲目也在29周内首次回到广告牌Hot 100上，将其第三周记录在第一周。

Billboard Japan Hot 100结合了物理和数字销售，音频流，无线电播放，视频视图和卡拉OK数据。

请参阅整个Billboard Japan Hot 100图表，从2月10日到16日，在此处统计。有关日本音乐和图表的更多信息，请访问Billboard日本的英语X帐户。

; 1235905728 肯德里克·拉马尔（Kendrick Lamar）令人惊叹的赛后碗图爆炸背后的最大原因是什么？ https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/kendrick-lamar-super-bowl-halftime-show-show-charts-five-five-burning-questions-1235905668/Eric Renner Brown Wed, 19 Feb 2025 21:42:51 +0000 Chart BeatMusicfive burning questionsgenre hiphop https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235905668 This week's Five Burning Questions looks at Kendrick Lamar's unprecedented week on the charts following his record-setting halftime performance at Super Bowl LIX.

根据NFL和主持人Apple Music的报道，肯德里克·拉马尔（Kendrick Lamar）在本周的广告牌排行榜上绝对无处不在。

在Billboard Hot 100 （日期为2月22日）上，Lamar拥有前10首歌曲中的五首，其中包括前五名和整个前三名。领先的是他已经精明的经典“不喜欢我们”，自2024年7月和第三周总共回归第一。同时，在Billboard 200上，Lamar在前10张专辑中的三张（有史以来第一个在该地区有三个同时参赛作品的说唱歌手中的三张）也包括他的第二周后期的Blockbuster GNX ，其中包括第一名的第一名。顶。

我们如何看待Lamar的图表主导地位？他能继续进行这次商业跑步多长时间？ Billboard员工在下面讨论了这些问题等。

肯德里克·拉马尔（Kendrick Lamar）在超级碗半场表演后的一周后，在Hot 100的前10名景点中有五个（包括前五名和整个前三名）中的五个，同时还在Billboard 200的前10名中发出了三张专辑，分别以“不喜欢我们”和GNX返回Hot 100和Billboard 200的顶部。从1-10的角度来看，您发现肯德里克（Kendrick）的赛后碗统治地位有多疯狂？

埃里克·雷纳·布朗（Eric Renner Brown） ：7。肯德里克（Kendrick）的超级碗半场表演提高了他的流媒体数字，我并不感到震惊。但是，在说唱歌手的12个月非常强大的12个月后，我对它们的增强程度感到惊讶。对我来说，尽管放弃了超级碗半场表演并专注于GNX材料的典型“最大命中”格式，但肯德里克的表演仍然将他的两张旧专辑提升为Billboard 200的前十名。

凯尔·丹尼斯（Kyle Denis） ：10。主要是因为我在2023年底将士气时代结束时根本没有看到任何东西。我一直都知道肯德里克（Kendrick）能够完全占据一年的统治地位。只是感觉他已经满足于该死的。以及2017 - 18年度的黑豹配乐。尽管GNX的提升令人兴奋，但考虑到这张专辑的大部分都生活在Hot 100的最高范围内，我对他们的印象并不深刻，自去年11月出人意料以来。好孩子马德城（Maad City）给我留下了深刻的印象，马德城（Maad City）没有看到它在中场休息时演奏的歌曲 - 重新进入Billboard 200的前10名（第10名）。或者更好的是，他的Jay摇滚辅助的“ Money Trees”（一个好孩子的深度剪裁，也被半场合作清单都经过了 - 最终在发行12年后在说唱流媒体歌曲的第11位首次亮相。

Angel Diaz ：我不是一个大人物，但这似乎很重要，所以我给它10个。看到那些类型的说唱单曲在图表的顶部是令人耳目一新的我们用来看到统治的通用聚会记录。

Jason Lipshutz ：一个8。两分，因为目前前十名的肯德里克歌曲中的大多数在半场提升之前已经相对较大了……但是，对于超级碗表现如何导致超级碗表现，这几乎是最好的场景图表优势。他的两张专辑中的两张专辑中的两张专辑本周返回Billboard 200排行榜的前十名，这表明了观众也返回他的后背目录的深度，这使超级碗展示了他的新歌，这是他的新歌。表演和动机，发现他没有的旧歌曲。

安德鲁·乌特伯格（Andrew Unterberger）：倾向于说10，只是因为这些细节对我来说仍然是令人难以置信的，但是肯德里克已经在这样的加热器前碗碗上，以至于可能不能高于9号。 - 这个S – T有多狂野？

2。我们从未见过艺术家在此级别上遇到过后碗的表现颠簸 - 如果您不得不选择一个，您认为这种前所未有的提升更多地是关于肯德里克的表现，他作为艺术家的整体及时性还是兴趣在他与德雷克的持续争执中？

埃里克·雷纳·布朗（Eric Renner Brown） ：授予，德雷克（Drake）在情人节（Valentine's Day）首次亮相他的partynextoor clobs $ ome $ exy $ exy $ ongs 4 u上发表了自己的俗气，这可能会归因于德雷克（Drake）的第一个“不喜欢我们”项目 - 或仅证明他正在进行的流行霸权。但是我倾向于将其归因于肯德里克作为艺术家的整体及时性。肯德里克（Kendrick）一生中的球迷们很喜欢，但不一定会因他的超级碗表演而震惊 - 根据一些媒体反应，我不确定这对他而言有那么多新的粉丝。如果有的话，它感觉是针对肯德里克（Kendrick Heads）量身定制的，它的GNX深度切割和高概念结构是什么。当然，肯德里克（Kendrick GNX和Kendrick目录的其余部分。

凯尔·丹尼斯（Kyle Denis ）：这些选择肯定是彼此之间不可或缺的，但我认为肯德里克（Kendrick）的整体及时性是最空前的，因为事情很少完美地列为这一点。从字面上看，我们从未见过一个说唱歌手，尤其是一个主要关注嘻哈音乐的精神而不是流行跨界策略的人 - 具有覆盖范围，目录和统治超级碗和格莱美奖的能力，赢得了一代人的说唱牛肉，赢得了一代人的说唱牛肉，他格莱美奖和赢得了普利策音乐奖，赢得了无与伦比的荣誉。而且，他在新的美国队长电影中有了一个主要的同步，与SZA一起迅速接近参加比赛，这是第一次专门参加体育场的嘻哈徒步旅行。

我认为，尽管他的表现在很大程度上被忽略了，但他的后卫目录得到了如此明显的提升，这意味着他的中场休息时间赢得了他的好奇心。我还认为，“路德”是创建最高的GNX轨道后碗碗，这可能意味着德雷克仇恨不再是人们现在正在调整K.Dot的音乐的主要原因。 “路德”显然与牛肉无关，就像绝大多数GNX一样，人们甚至在这一切之外都在与他的音乐联系在一起，这也表明了肯德里克目前的整体及时性。

Angel Diaz ：对不起，但是唯一的答案就是上述所有内容。乔治·克鲁尼（George Clooney）和马克·沃尔伯格（Mark Wahlberg）将这样的情况称为完美的风暴。肯德里克（Kendrick）独自获得了第一张专辑和第一张专辑，但是Drake Blowout，获得超级碗，并通过放下一张惊喜专辑来利用这种情况，该专辑将其收回到他的部分。80和G Ood Kid ，Maad City Days在过去的一年中帮助了他的个人资料爆炸。只有少数说唱歌手疯狂地奔跑。未来和50美分是我脑海中浮现的两个。

Jason Lipshutz ：他的整体及时性。是的， “不喜欢我们”仍然是Drake-Piñata饲料的巨大在2024年定义了流行音乐。他在中场休息时甚至没有接触过的一些歌曲和专辑仍进入了Hot 100的前十名Billboard 200分别表明，对Lamar音乐的普遍渴望超越了超级碗或任何争执。

安德鲁·恩特伯格（Andrew Unterberger）：我要说的是德雷克（Drake）的仇恨，因为我仍然相信对这种特定表现的兴趣水平（无论是进入它还是从中出现），首先是与他是否要去的问题有关玩“不喜欢我们”。但是毫无疑问，肯德里克（Kendrick）的2024-25提高流行和整体影响会超过这种牛肉，而且我认为他的新粉丝比我们大多数人可能意识到这一表现更多的新粉丝，那些不在乎，也可能永远不会关心的粉丝关心这部特殊的戏剧。

3。除了图表的情况外，您是否看到或经历了更多的轶事示例，表明肯德里克·拉马尔（Kendrick Lamar）在上周左右的文化和对话中对文化和对话表示了多少？ （要么是现实生活中的/在线互动，要么您在较大的文化中看到的与与图表相关的较大文化。）

埃里克·雷纳·布朗（Eric Renner Brown） ：我的父亲 - 一位折衷，贪婪的听众，他定期听肯德里克（Kendrick）的历史可以追溯到好孩子- 超级碗后两天与我联系，并链接到“不喜欢我们”，并说“我喜欢这样！”他要求我向他解释德雷克的仇恨。第二天，他发送了“争吵”（“和这个！”）和“转世”（“这很好！”）的链接。肯德里克（Kendrick）十多年来一直没有在地下感觉，但是在这个超级碗半场表演中，感觉就像他进入了主流并获得了新的明星水平。

凯尔·丹尼斯（Kyle Denis）：我在即将到来的最伟大的流行歌星播客中提到了这一点，但情人节周末让我感到惊讶！在星期五晚上（2月14日）晚餐后，我和我的情人去了时代广场的一个俱乐部的R＆B夜晚。当然，我希望听到$ OME $ exy $ ongs 4 u的声音，因为这是当天出现的，或者至少是毛毛雨或派对的一些较旧的曲目。取而代之的是，DJ没有播放任何一位艺术家的歌曲，但还没有找到一种方法来挤进“电视Off”和“ Peekaboo”的GNX Medley，“ Luther”在当晚晚些时候出现。不用说，康普顿孩子在扬声器中大胆的一切都疯狂了。

安吉尔·迪亚兹（Angel Diaz） ：他的采访蒂米·蒂姆（Timmy Tim），又名TimothéeChalamet，参加了超级碗。他们似乎现在是各自领域中被选中的人，他们已经能够将流行文化的Zeitgeist带入您的父母知道自己的身份。有白人祖母在社交媒体上弹跳到肯德里克（Kendrick）的半场表现，而查拉梅特（Chalamet）通过揭露他的尼克斯·狂热（Nicks Fandom）的方式进入了体育领域，并且是该节目50年历史上的第五名非招待者。

Jason Lipshutz ：自超级碗半场表演以来已经有10天了，我们仍在谈论它 - 在线，现实生活中，与朋友，同事和家庭亲戚在肯德里克（Kendrick）的表现以及一切的含义。这是超级碗半场话语的反常性，无论头条新闻多大，它通常都具有一两天的保质期。 Not everybody loved Lamar's halftime show, but there's no denying its standing as a cultural lightning rod with a long tail of listenership — exactly what the NFL, and Kendrick himself, must have wanted.

Andrew Unterberger : I look at the SNL 50th Anniversary Homecoming Concert from Friday, where Kendrick was not present, but still got multiple center-stage moments — including yet another “ A-minorrrrrr ” singalong moment for a huge crowd of famous people with millions more watching from home. When you loom large over every major event even when you're not there, that's when you've really got the juice like no one else.

4. While “Not Like Us” resumes the top spot this week, “Luther” (with SZA) also hits a new peak of No. 2, and should threaten for pole position next week. Why do you think that song has emerged as the enduring popular favorite from GNX , and did the Super Bowl performance help cement that status?

Eric Renner Brown : I'm not so quick to label “Luther” the enduring popular favorite off GNX ! One of the popular favorites?当然。 But “Peekaboo” has achieved TikTok virality with its “Bing-bop-boom-boom-boom-bop-bam/ The type of shit I'm on, you wouldn't understand” line, while “Squabble Up” is a No. 1 hit with a memorable music video, and the “ MUSTAAAAARD !” line in “TV Off” is already iconic enough to work without context in a Heinz ad. “luther” is also great, buoyed as it may be by SZA's presence – and their collaboration at the halftime show certainly fortified its numbers. But ultimately, GNX is stacked with some of the most accessible, enjoyable music of Kendrick's career. These songs and more will all pop off when he and SZA hit the stadium circuit in a couple months.

Kyle Denis : In December, I predicted “Luther” to be the most enduring GNX track and I'm standing by that. It's the song on GNX with the widest appeal, it's the best new SZA song we've gotten since she started expanding SOS , and its cozy loved-up balladry is perfect for the winter. I don't think “Luther” was even in the top three most memorable music moments from the halftime show, but I think its slot there combined with forthcoming sure-to-be viral tour performances will help further cement the song's legacy.

Angel Diaz : The song is just so damn catchy and fun for the whole family. I've seen videos of toddlers singing along to it. There's also the Luther Vandross sample, and who doesn't love Luther?

Jason Lipshutz : “Squabble Up” and “TV Off” are flashier rap singles, but “Luther” locates the midway point between two superstars: the chemistry between Kendrick Lamar and SZA crackles phenomenally on the track, their tones circling the Luther Vandross (and Cheryl Lynn) sample and bouncing off the subtly deployed strings in a way that pop, R&B and hip-hop fans can appreciate in equal measure. A Super Bowl performance is always going help matters commercially, but “Luther” was likely going to hit No. 1 on the Hot 100 at some point regardless; next week might finally be that point.

Andrew Unterberger : It's just the most generally agreeable song on the album for casual listeners, and probably the most playlistable as well. I don't think the Super Bowl performance added a ton to the song, except for giving it the same boost it's given the rest of his catalog.

5. It's been almost a year since this Kendrick run first kicked off with “Like That” last March. What do you think is more likely — that his dominance will start to slow down soon, or that it'll still feel this pervasive when we're getting into year-end season?

Eric Renner Brown : Kendrick will only continue to feel dominant as he hits the road with SZA for his first stadium tour – he has a mass appeal right now that he simply hasn't had in the past. But the wild card is how much he wants that. Prior to 2024, Kendrick – who I believed throughout the '10s could've been a Drake-level hitmaker, if he'd wanted to pursue that direction instead of the knottier, more complex music that earned him a Pulitzer – has evaded the spotlight, taking breaks when he gained momentum and eschewing more commercial plays. With GNX , the Super Bowl halftime show, and now his stadium tour, he doesn't seem to be currently in that headspace.我们将看到它持续多久。

Kyle Denis : It will be very hard for Kendrick's dominance to feel pervasive because he is not a very present, forward-facing star. “Not Like Us” has officially been No. 1 for more weeks than the number of times Kendrick has given televised live performances of the song. He's not someone that's constantly on social media posting to his finsta and linking with Twitch streamers. He drops music, performs, gives one or two (probably contractually obligated) interviews and goes home.

Kendrick also isn't one to flood the market with music; it's not likely he keeps pumping out new content, so as consumers, we're not likely to feel inundated or overwhelmed by how present he is in the marketplace. Now, if the Grand National tour ends up becoming a cultural phenomenon like the Renaissance World Tour or Eras Tour, we might have to revisit this conversation.

Angel Diaz : I think that totally depends on Drake. If he continues with his antics: the lawsuits, the memes, the trolling. Then maybe Dot will take his foot off his neck, but until then, I fear the boogeyman isn't going anywhere anytime soon. His stadium tour is kicking off at the end of April, and you gotta think he has something else up his sleeve — like maybe a verse on the new Clipse album (allegedly/rumored innuendo.) I would put money on the onslaught continuing. I think that would be a pretty safe bet.

Jason Lipshutz : The latter. GNX has more singles to spin off, and Lamar has been re-energized as a recording artist during this run, to the point where the five-year gap between DAMN. and Mr. Morale now feels out of the question. We've got a summer stadium tour alongside SZA coming up, GNX will be eligible at the 2026 Grammys, and whatever Kendrick decides to release in between — his ubiquity is not lagging anytime soon.

Andrew Unterberger : Yeah, it might not be an every week thing — though it also might be an every week thing — but the level that Kendrick is at right now I think means that he's going to continue to make waves (and headlines) almost by default for pretty much the rest of the year, regardless of whether or not he releases any more music. And honestly, if I had to bet, I would say he probably does release some more music; he seems to realize what a special run it is that he's on right now, and I would bet he's got at least a little more to say while he's still in this bright a spotlight.

; 1235905668 Photos From EMPIRE and Billboard's Sports and Music Power Event https://www.billboard.com/photos/empire-billboard-sports-music-2025-event-1235905550/Jenny Regan Wed, 19 Feb 2025 21:22:32 +0000 BusinessRecord LabelsEmpiresports https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=pmc-gallery&p=1235905550 On Saturday, Feb. 15, Billboard and EMPIRE came together at EMPIRE’s San Francisco studios to celebrate Billboard’s second annual Sports and Music issue.

On Saturday, Feb. 15, Billboard and EMPIRE came together at EMPIRE's San Francisco studios to celebrate Billboard ’s second annual Sports and Music issue , honoring some of the most powerful people operating at the intersection of the industries of sports and music. The issue, which features EMPIRE founder/CEO Ghazi on the cover , as well as a second flip cover featuring Travis Scott, delves into Ghazi's deep connection with his hometown Bay Area, and his work in bringing the music business back to the region, while also including features on pep bands playing pop music, the music connections with WWE, and more.

The event was DJ'd by KMAT and attended by many of the Sports and Music list honorees attended, as well as artists such as Too Short, Trae Tha Truth, Wale, NLE Choppa, Doria, DJ Luke Nasty and Rexx Life Raj. During the party, Billboard director of business news Dan Rys presented the inaugural Billboard Sports & Music Innovator Award to 2K's director of global partnerships and licensing David Kelley, and Billboard president Mike Van presented Ghazi with his Billboard cover. “It's physically me on that cover, but it's not really about me, it's about us,” Ghazi said in a speech.

That speech was followed by a surprise presentation by California state assemblyman Matt Haney, who presented Ghazi, EMPIRE COO Nima Etminan, EMPIRE president Tina Davis and others with a certificate of recognition from the state of California, marking the 15th anniversary of the company Ghazi founded 2010年。

“You brought music from all over the world, from Latin America, from Africa, to every single corner of the globe, from right here [in San Francisco],” Haney said in a speech. “And you've done it with integrity. You didn't have to be the biggest record label, you did it your way. And you've inspired and touched so many people through that and your love and your commitment.” 

; 1235905550 Billboard's Music Industry Events Calendar https://www.billboard.com/pro/music-industry-events-calendar-festivals-awards-conferences/Colin Stutz Wed, 19 Feb 2025 21:22:00 +0000 BusinessBusiness Newsbillboard proconferencesEventsfestivalsTouring https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235579000 A complete rundown of the most important events across the music business.

As part of our continuing efforts to serve the music industry and its creators, Billboard Pro now features a music industry events calendar for readers.

The calendar will act as music's most complete summary major national and international industry events, from conferences to festivals to networking mixers and more. Just as Billboard is music's must-read source for news, charts and analysis, now it also is the go-to for business happenings.

; 1235579000 Why Tate McRae Says Working With Boyfriend The Kid Laroi on New Album Was 'A Little Stressful' https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/tate-mcrae-kid-laroi-collab-so-close-to-what-album-listening-party-1235905600/Katie Atkinson Wed, 19 Feb 2025 21:19:59 +0000 MusicPopgenre popMusic News https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235905600 At her Spotify listening party for third album So Close to What , McRae gives fans an early listen of the Friday release & opens up about its creation.;

Tate McRae is stepping into a new era with her third studio album, So Close to What , set for release Friday. To celebrate, McRae partnered with Spotify for an intimate listening party on Tuesday night at The Living Room in Los Angeles, where 40 fans got an exclusive first listen.

From the moment the first song played, the energy in the room was electric. Fans were dancing, jumping and fully immersed, reacting in real time as McRae unveiled her most personal and dynamic project yet.

有关的

Tate McRae Announces New Album 'So Close to What' & 2025 World Tour

11/14/2024

The night wasn't just about the music. It also featured a Q&A session with McRae's best friend, social media personality Jake Shane . Their dynamic was effortless, filled with playful banter, inside jokes and genuine excitement for the album. Shane, one of McRae's biggest supporters, couldn't hide his enthusiasm, especially for his favorite track of the night. Before “Signs” played, he hyped it up to the room, blurting out, “It's so good!” McRae laughed, adding, “It's a really fun, sarcastic pop song. … I can't wait for everyone to hear it.” The second it started, the entire room was moving. The track is pure spring and summer energy — made for blasting in the car, top down, cruising with friends.

McRae's So Close to What delivers a mix of vulnerability and high-energy anthems, showing her evolution as an artist. One of the biggest crowd favorites of the night was “Revolving Door.” The second it started, fans latched onto it, jumping and dancing without hesitation. It's a song that demands movement, a full-blown party record with pulsing energy. The room was completely alive, and it was impossible not to picture this track blowing up on playlists and club remixes.

On the opposite end of the spectrum, “Purple Lace Bra” slowed things down, bringing an introspective, emotional energy. McRae described it as her response to the media, a raw and deeply personal track. Speaking on the theme of the album, she explained, “The album title encapsulates how I felt turning 21 … feeling like you're finally a woman while also wrestling with how the media portrays you.”

Then there was “Green Light,” a track about the exhilarating-yet-terrifying feeling of falling in love again. It captures the tension of hesitation and excitement, like waiting at a green light, unsure whether to move forward. The mix of vulnerability and an infectious beat makes it an instant fan favorite — one of those songs that lingers long after it ends.

But the highlight of the night: “Bloodonmyhands,” featuring Flo Milli. The second the beat dropped, the entire room erupted. People stood up, danced and completely lost themselves in the music. It was giving summer 2016 — chaotic, fun, completely unfiltered energy. And Flo Milli, she ate. Her delivery, her confidence, her flow — she brought exactly what the song needed, and the crowd's reaction said it all.

During the chat, McRae opened up about much of the album leaking ahead of her release date, which she called a “f—ing bummer.” “I was just so devastated because I'm like, 'There's nothing I can do about this.'” McRae combated the leak by getting back in the studio and writing some new songs to add to the project, including what would become the Flo Milli collab, plus “Like I Do.”

McRae also gave fans insight into her creative process, revealing that her alter ego played a big role in shaping some of the songs. “Tatiana, my alter ego, wrote a lot of the songs on the album — including 'Sports Car,'” she shared of her latest single.

One of the most anticipated collaborations is “I Know Love,” her song with boyfriend The Kid Laroi, which came together in a way neither of them expected. “It was a really funny process, because me and Laroi have never really, like, taken each other seriously,” she laughed. “You know when you're in a relationship and you sing around each other, but you don't really, like, sing ? So it was a little stressful being in the studio singing and writing in front of him, but it was a cool experience to watch him in his process.”

McRae closes the album with “Nostalgia,” a deeply personal track that lingers long after the final note. It's the perfect ending to an album that takes listeners through every high and low.

The listening party proved that So Close to What will be a defining moment in McRae's career. Fans connected instantly with the songs, and the energy in the room was undeniable. With her Miss Possessive Tour kicking off in March, this is just the beginning. If the reactions at the listening event were any indication, McRae's biggest era yet has officially arrived.

; 1235905600 Sean 'Diddy' Combs' Lawyers Say Sex Trafficking Charge Has Racist Origins, Ask Judge to Dismiss It https://www.billboard.com/pro/diddy-lawyers-sex-trafficking-charge-racist-origins/Michael Saponara Wed, 19 Feb 2025 21:08:32 +0000 BusinessLegal Newsgenre hiphopLegalMusic Newsnsfs https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235905488 The hip-hop mogul's legal team claims the Mann Act, a 1910 law under which the charge was brought, was "used to target Black men and supposedly protect white women from them."

Sean “Diddy” Combs ' attorneys have filed a motion seeking the dismissal of a sex trafficking charge in the hip-hop mogul's indictment, citing the alleged racist origins of the count.

Combs' legal team, which made the filing official on Tuesday (Feb. 18) in New York federal court, argues that “no white person has ever been the target of a remotely similar prosecution” under The Mann Act — a 1910 law from which the sex trafficking charge stems. Formerly known as the White-Slave Traffic Act, the Mann Act aims to prohibit the trafficking of women and the transporting of prostitutes.

有关的

Jay-Z, Sean 'Diddy' Combs Rape Lawsuit Dismissed

02/14/2025

“There has never been a similar RICO prosecution,” the filing states, adding: “Mr.康姆斯之所以被挑出，是因为他是一个有力的黑人，并且因经常受到惩罚的行为而被起诉。”

Combs' attorneys go on to argue that the government's handling of the case has shown “bias and animus” and that it has gone out of its way to “humiliate” him in the process.

“The unusual theory of Count Three — transporting escorts across state lines for purposes
of prostitution — has never been brought before under this Act, which has a long and troubling
history as a statute with racist origins, used to target Black men and supposedly protect white
women from them,” the filing continues.

Combs is still awaiting the start of his criminal trial, which is set to kick off on May 5. The 55-year-old was arrested in September and is currently being held at Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn. He faces sex trafficking and racketeering charges, with prosecutors asserting that he was running a criminal enterprise looking to satisfy his need for “sexual gratification.” He is also accused of acts of violence and intimidation to keep his alleged victims from speaking out. Combs faces a potential sentence of life in prison if convicted on all charges.

; 1235905488 Kane Brown Spotlights His Tour Openers From Stage to Song: 'This Is About Creating a Moment for Everybody' https://www.billboard.com/music/country/kane-brown-says-i-can-the-high-road-tour-openers-1235905579/Jessica Nicholson Wed, 19 Feb 2025 20:46:59 +0000 CountryMusicgenre countryhttps://www.billboard.com/?p=1235905579 Brown’s manager, Martha Earls, shares the story behind Brown’s “Says I Can (The High Road Tour Version)” with tour openers Ashley Cooke, Dasha, Mitchell Tenpenny and Scotty McCreery.

When Kane Brown embarks on his headlining The High Road Tour March 13 in San Diego, California, the tour will not only highlight 12-time Billboard Country Airplay chart-topper Brown's consistent hitmaker status and enduring headliner draw but also marks a significant opportunity for his opening acts to solidify their own connections with Brown's fanbase.

As a precursor to the tour, Brown has released to DSPs “Says I Can (The High Road Tour Version),” a collaborative rendition of his country-leaning song featuring his tour openers, “Your Place” singer Ashley Cooke, “Austin” hitmaker Dasha, “Truth About You” singer Mitchell Tenpenny and five-time Country Airplay hitmaker Scotty McCreery trading off verses and joining together on a chorus ready-made for arena-sized singalongs.

“[The goal] is to really amplify everything we are trying to do, and also highlight the great talent that we are taking out on the road with Kane,” Brown's longtime manager, Neon Coast's Martha Earls, tells Billboard . “They are all super talented, so why not highlight them?”

The concept of a headlining act welcoming openers back to the stage for a group singalong is a consistent element in country music concerts, whether they team up on one of the headliner's own hits or pluck a tune from country music's deep trove of fan favorites. Brown has regularly welcomed his openers to join him on songs during his shows, such as welcoming Restless Road to sing “One Mississippi” on his 2022-2023 Drunk or Dreaming Tour, or inviting Jordan Davis and Restless Road to sing on “Famous Friends” during Brown's 2021 Blessed & Free Tour, which visited all 29 NBA basketball venues.

Brown's dedication to spotlighting his opening acts stems from his own early days, when Brown was opening shows for Florida Georgia Line. “FGL asked him to come out and be one of four [openers] on their tour, and they were so nice to him,” Earls says. “And then it all came full circle in 2024, when we had [former FGL member] Tyler Hubbard as our direct support. They really set the precedent of how to incorporate openers and make them feel like they are part of the tour. That's something that is important to Kane and why he's always brought openers out on a song.”

Brown's move is not without precedent: Five years ago, Miranda Lambert put out a cover of Elvin Bishop's “Fooled Around and Fell in Love” prior to the launch of her 2019 Roadside Bars and Pink Guitars Tour, with openers including Maren Morris, Ashley McBryde and Caylee Hammack; they also performed the song together during Lambert's concerts.

Earls notes the lilting, warm “Says I Can,” a track from Brown's The High Road album, naturally lent itself to a sing-a-long.

The idea came from Brown's A&R executive at Sony Music Nashville, Margaret Tomlin. “She said, 'What if we made a recording of “Says I Can” and put the openers on it?' We loved the idea, because at the end of the day, let's make it all cohesive and make what people are seeing onstage, then [be what] they can hop in their car and listen to and remember that moment,” Earls says.

“All of the openers were eager and excited to be part of it, which felt nice and expressed like, 'Okay, this is more than just going out and playing shows. This is about creating a moment for everybody every night,” Earls adds.

Brown first recorded the solo version of “Says I Can” last summer while making his The High Road album, while Cooke, Dasha, McCreery and Tenpenny put their vocals on The High Road Tour version of “Says I Can” during the days leading up to The High Road release on Jan. 31. Each artist contributed their individual part from various locales — Tenpenny was in Australia, Cooke was in Nashville, Dasha was in Los Angeles, and McCreery was gearing up for a songwriters' retreat on the East coast.

“They are all complementary, but different,” Earls says of the artists' vocals. “The vocals each came in and we threw it all at [Brown's producer] Dann Huff and he mixed them together. [We wanted] to be able to put this out in advance of the tour and give the fans a glimpse of some of what they will experience.”

Brown tied in a social media aspect to the song and the tour, filming off-the-cuff video of himself FaceTiming with Cooke, Dasha, McCreery, and Tenpenny and holding up a green cup for a “Cheers Challenge” to promote the new song 。

“I'm texting Dasha, like, 'Can you answer a FaceTime right now?'” Earls recalls of pulling the video together. “There's a funny video of her answering while she's driving, and she's like, 'I can't find an exit to pull off, let me call you guys back.' So, it was all very sweet.”

The time span from inviting the opening acts to take part in the song to finished recording and making social media clip took less than two weeks. “I feel like we're creating a little bond from the start, from before we even step out into the first show in San Diego,” Earls says.

“All of the teams stepped up and jumped on making the videos and making the social media moments happen. That was part of the fun, too,” Earls adds. “We see everything on social media — tour clips, music video clips. Why not interweave it all? An even more extreme example might be when Kane and Jelly Roll are performing at Buckeye Superfest [in Columbus, Ohio on June 25]. They have a song together [“Haunted”] and I can't wait until that night when they play that song together. I think it is going to be so powerful and such a moment. That's the fun part of collaborating in the music industry, and I think the sum can be greater than the parts sometimes.”

; 1235905579
